text: Shark Bay is a large bay on the west coast of Western Australia. It is about north of Perth. In 1991, the bay, its islands, and the land around it were added to UNESCO's list of World Heritage Sites.UNESCO, "Shark Bay, Western Australia"; retrieved 2012-4-23. Shark Bay has three important features to protect. It has the largest seagrass beds in the world. These are home to about 10% of the world's dugongs. And at one end of the bay are stromatolites, which are the oldest form of life on the Earth. The protected area covers . ==World Heritage Site== The area protected by the World Heritage Site is made up of different areas. About 70% of the site is marine environment protected by national parks and reserves, and includes of coastline. About 20% was used for farming, but half of this area has been taken over by the government and is now conservation area. About 6% is in national parks and reserves. ===Parks and reserves=== * Bernier Island * Dirk Hartog Island National Park * Dorre Island * Charlie Island * Faure Island Sanctuary * Francois Peron National Park * Friday Island * Hamelin Pool Marine Nature Reserve * Hamelin Pool/East Faure Island High-Low Water Mark * Koks Island * Monkey Mia * Shark Bay Marine Park * Shell Beach Conservation Park * Small Islands * Zuytdorp Nature Reserve == Related pages == *List of World Heritage Sites in Australia ==References == ==Other websites== * Shark Bay website Category:World Heritage Sites in Australia Category:Geography of Western Australia Category:Australian National Heritage List
title: Shark Bay
